events.message: The customer reported an accident involving their vehicle hitting a roadside barrier on April 30th at 7 PM.
After reviewing the initial report, the claim was categorised under auto accident due to collision and vehicle damage.
An insurance agent was assigned to manage the claim and communicate with the customer regarding next steps.
The insurer formally acknowledged receipt of the claim and assured the customer that the case would be handled promptly.
Documentation including police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and repair estimates were requested from the customer.
The customer submitted all requested documents, including the police report and detailed repair estimates from the mechanic.
Investigation commenced to verify claim details, vehicle condition, and corroborate the accident circumstances provided.
Investigation concluded with findings supporting the customer’s account of the collision and confirming damage assessments.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover repair costs and provide additional compensation for temporary transportation expenses.
The customer responded positively, expressing gratitude for the timely processing and fair settlement proposed.
Approval was granted for the settlement amount agreed upon with the customer, finalizing the claim terms.
Payment for the approved settlement was issued to the customer’s account to cover damages and additional expenses.
The claim was officially closed following payment issuance and confirmation that the customer was satisfied with the resolution.
All documents and records related to the auto accident claim were archived as part of routine data retention procedures.
